newsitem.title: GERMANY: McCann-Erickson takes over German health agency.
newsitem.headline: McCann-Erickson takes over German health agency.

text.p: International advertising group McCann-Erickson Healthcare Worldwide said on Friday it had bought the majority stake in Munich health communications agency Medizinischer Creativ Service GmbH (MCS).

McCann-Erickson Deutschland GmbH, the advertising giant's German subsidiary, announced the acquisition and said it would strengthen the company's presence in Germany, Europe's largest health care market.
MCS, a small independent unit, offers advertising, public relations, audio-visual production services and medical training and counts Eli Lilly, Amgen, Roche, Wm. Wrigley Jr Co among its clients.
McCann-Erickson in Germany said Michael Fischer and Hedwig Weisser would stay on as MCS's directors after the acquisition.
McCann-Erickson Healthcare Worldwide's subsidiaries in more than 12 countries bring in annual profits of about $50 million.

McCann-Erickson Worldwide, which posts annual billings of more than nine billion dollars, is owned by the Interpublic Group of Companies Inc holding in New York, which also owns Ammirati Puris Lintas group.
